semantic_title: Coding All Clinically Significant Conditions in Newborns
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 16. Chapter 16: Certain Conditions Originating in the Perinatal Period > a. General Perinatal Rules > 6) Code all clinically significant conditions

content.full_text: All clinically significant conditions noted on routine newborn examination should be coded. A condition is clinically significant if it requires: clinical evaluation; or therapeutic treatment; or diagnostic procedures; or extended length of hospital stay; or increased nursing care and/or monitoring; or has implications for future health care needs. Note: The perinatal guidelines listed above are the same as the general coding guidelines for "additional diagnoses," except for the final point regarding implications for future health care needs. Codes should be assigned for conditions that have been specified by the provider as having implications for future health care needs. (Evidence: pg no: 72, L93-L102)
content.summary: Code all clinically significant newborn conditions that require evaluation, treatment, procedures, extended stay, increased monitoring, or have future healthcare implications. (Evidence: pg no: 72, L93-L102)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code conditions requiring clinical evaluation (Evidence: pg no: 72, L95)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any condition that requires clinical evaluation by healthcare providers should be coded, even if no treatment is provided (Evidence: pg no: 72, L95)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code conditions requiring therapeutic treatment (Evidence: pg no: 72, L96)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any condition that requires therapeutic intervention or treatment should be coded (Evidence: pg no: 72, L96)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code conditions requiring diagnostic procedures (Evidence: pg no: 72, L97)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any condition that necessitates diagnostic procedures should be coded (Evidence: pg no: 72, L97)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code conditions causing extended length of hospital stay (Evidence: pg no: 72, L98)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any condition that results in prolonged hospitalization should be coded (Evidence: pg no: 72, L98)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code conditions requiring increased nursing care and/or monitoring (Evidence: pg no: 72, L99)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any condition that necessitates enhanced nursing care or closer monitoring should be coded (Evidence: pg no: 72, L99)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code conditions with implications for future health care needs (Evidence: pg no: 72, L100)
detailed_rules.explanation: Conditions that have implications for future healthcare needs should be coded when specified by the provider, which is unique to perinatal guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 72, L100-L102)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify all conditions noted on newborn examination
Step 2: Evaluate each condition against the six criteria
Step 3: Code any condition meeting at least one criterion
Step 4: Ensure provider has specified future healthcare implications when applicable
